text: Easily one of my favorite N64 games. I imagine that title and box art didn't speak to most, but the gameplay was fun and the dialogue was funny. Between this and DBZ airing on cartoon network (Toonami) for the first time is when I started getting into anime.

author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: For an N64 3D Platformer, this was one game that truly had it all. Graphics, exploration, large worlds, diverse, dungeons, and multiple methods of battle. The sheer variety that game had to offer arguably rivals even the two Zelda games on the same console!
author: Madman Asa

text: So many happy memories.. Everytime I feel caught up or lost, I'm so thankful for good childhood music like this to pull me back toward myself.

author: youkilledkiller22

text:
Did you ever play Goemon's Great Adventure on the N64?  It contained some of the best music on the 64, in my opinion - all the castle themes were appropriately ridiculous(ly awesome.)

Of course, it wasn't exactly Mystical Ninja style, but 2.5D platforming was something that I enjoyed at the time.

text: You could play it!
author: Zenju

text: I love Goemon! I was listening to Goemon's Great Adventure's soundtrack today!
author: Zenju

text: For those of you talking about sequels to this game, check out "16 bit gems - Legend of the Mystical Ninja" for a review of the whole "Goemon" series, especially the title entry, for snes. It's a good game.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: This was a cool game! I love the impact theme too! Alot of nostalgic music in this game for me
author: Winamp

text: I'd have to say this is easily among my all-time favorite games. Everything about it was great, the level design, the characters, and the music. The robot battles were awesome, too bad there was only 4 battles in total. And the 4 character dynamic really made it stand out as a game. Thanks for posting the song, probably my second favorite tune in the whole game, next to the gourmet submarine castle theme. Brings back good memories just hearing this.
author: Retrauk

text:
I totally remember this song and I loved the game. It was a real experience and something i don't think I've ever played thats replicated it apart from possibly Opoona. 
It's a very cool game and more people need it! A new version or maybe a 3DS remake?

text: I remember begging my parents to buy this game for me at Toys R Us for 74.99. It took me years to beat it because I never bought a controller pak until I borrowed it from someone. I still love the music~
author: seraphofevil

text: I remember this game being one of the first i played that required the n64 memory pak. So because of that I ended up renting it and beating it about 10 hours later. Fun times.
author: Vauldemare

text: I remember loving the graphics as a kid. I don't remember this song but the cover is so nostalgic, I always used to rent this game when I saw it in the blockbuster
author: SlRDancealot

text: One of my favorite games on the console. Probably in my Top 5 N64 games not made by Nintendo. I'd love a new Goemon game in the same style! The gameplay was very nice with its mix of adventuring and platforming using the 4 different characters. Plus it had first person giant robot battles, so many fun memories!
author: SupraDarky
